result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathleen E. Edwards

defendant.name: Edwards, Kathleen E.
defendant.address: 233 E. Polk Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Richard White.
State by Benjamin Webster, ADA.
Preliminary hearing waived in 15CF1001- waiver accepted by Court.
Defendant advised of Constitutional rights/Guilty Plea form.
Agreement reached.

IT IS ORDERED that the signature bond is modified so that the requirement for CTC testing shall not be in place for the time period of November 24, 2015 - November 29, 2015.
/s/ November 20, 2015

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against J.E.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant is not to be in a vehicle transporting alcohol or have alcohol in residence.
Report to CTC within 24 hours for random/daily testing and/or programming.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license and only if absolutely sober.

Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license and only if absolutely sober.

Defendant appeared with Attorney Rich White
State by: Derek Dominguez, ADA
Plea/Sentencing: 11/19/15 at 4:30pm

Defendant appeared with Attorney Richard White
State by: Ben Webster, ADA
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing and court finds waiver is made freely, voluntarily and with advice of counsel

to Modify Bond
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the condition requiring compliance with CTC testing does not apply on September 2, 3, and 4, as the Defendant will be out of the State of Wisconsin during those dates. All other conditions of bond will remain in full force and effect.
/s/ September 1, 2015

Defendant appeared with Attorney Jessie Weber
